## network meta-analysis model

### meta-analysis

$$
\boldsymbol y \sim \text{normal}(\mu + \boldsymbol \theta, \boldsymbol \sigma^2)\\
\boldsymbol \theta \sim \text{normal}(0, \tau^2)
$$

### bayesian network meta-analysis

\[
\left.
\begin{array}{c r c l}
\text{prior} & \boldsymbol d & \sim & \text{normal}(\boldsymbol d_0, \boldsymbol \Sigma_d)\\
\text{likelihood} & \boldsymbol y | \boldsymbol d & \sim & \text{normal}(\boldsymbol \delta, \boldsymbol V)\\
\text{fixed effects model} &  \boldsymbol \delta &=& \boldsymbol{Xd}
\end{array}
\right\}
\]

## create network object

```{r}
parkinsons_net <-
    set_agd_contrast(
        parkinsons,
        study = studyn,
        trt = trtn,
        y = diff,
        se = se_diff,
        sample_size = n
    )

```



## network meta-analysis model | prior

```{r}
# prior
summary(normal(scale = 100))

```

an example of an area I would like to learn more about; selection of priors. 

## network meta-analysis model | `::nma`

```{r}
# fit model to network object
parkinsons_nma <-
    nma(
        # network object
        parkinsons_net, 
        
        # fixed; for brevity w sensitivity
        trt_effects = "fixed", 
        
        # set prior on treatment contrast with placebo
        prior_trt = normal(scale = 100))

```

## leave one out | exclude a random study from the network meta-analysis

```{r include=FALSE}
# choose a random study
study_to_filter <- 
  parkinsons_dat%>% 
  pull(studyn) %>% 
  unique() %>% 
  sample(1)

leave_one_out_plot <-
parkinsons_dat%>% 
  filter(studyn != study_to_filter) %>% 
     set_agd_contrast(
       # data
       .,
        study = studyn,
        trt = trtn,
        y = diff,
        se = se_diff,
        sample_size = n
    ) %>% 
      nma(
        # network object
        .,
        
        # fixed; for brevity w sensitivity
        trt_effects = "fixed", 
        
        # set prior on treatment contrast with placebo
        prior_trt = normal(scale = 100)) %>% 
  plot()


```

## leave m out 

```{r combinations, include=FALSE,warning=FALSE}
# get combinations of treatments
# ::combn w ::t might be useful
all_trt_comb <-
  parkinsons_dat%>%
  select(studyn, trtn)

trt_comb <- 
all_trt_comb %>%
  pull(studyn) %>%
  unique() %>%
  map_df(
    .f = function(study) {
      all_trt_comb %>%
        filter(studyn == study) %>%
        pull(trtn) %>%
        combn(2) %>%
        t() %>%
        as_tibble()
    }
  ) %>%
  distinct() %>% 
  filter(V1 == 2)


```

```{r include=FALSE}



# trial function

trial <- function(studies_to_include) {
  
  trial_model <-
  parkinsons_dat%>% 
    filter(studyn %in% studies_to_include) %>% 
     set_agd_contrast(
       # data
       .,
        study = studyn,
        trt = trtn,
        y = diff,
        se = se_diff,
        sample_size = n
    ) %>% 
      nma(
        # network object
        .,
        
        # fixed; for brevity w sensitivity
        trt_effects = "fixed", 
        
        # set prior on treatment contrast with placebo
        prior_trt = normal(scale = 100))
  
  summary(trial_model, par = "d") %>% 
    as_tibble() %>% 
    select(parameter, mean) %>% 
    arrange(mean) %>%
    mutate(rank = row_number(),
           k = length(studies_to_include)) %>% 
    select(-mean)

}

# extract study combinations
studies <-
  parkinsons_dat%>% 
  pull(studyn) %>% 
  unique() 

study_inclusions <-
  3:length(studies) %>% 
  map_df(.f = function(k){
  combn(
    x = studies,
    m = k,
    simplify = FALSE
  ) %>% 
      tibble(
        k = k,
        included_studies = .
      )
  }) 


```

```{r include=FALSE}
rankings <-
  study_inclusions %>%
  pull(included_studies) %>% 
  map_df(trial) 

```

```{r echo=FALSE, fig.height=5, fig.align="center"}
rankings %>%
  # filter(k != 7#, 
  #        # !str_detect(parameter, "4")
  #        ) %>%
  mutate(rank = as_factor(rank)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = parameter, fill = rank)) +
           geom_bar(alpha = 0.6) +
  ggthemes::theme_economist_white() +
  rockthemes::scale_fill_nodoubt() +
  facet_wrap(~k) +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    title = "network meta-analysis study subset ranking distributions", 
    subtitle = str_wrap("on treatments for all subsets of 3 or greater of the available 7 studies", 80),
    y = "number of combinations of k studies that measure treatment",
    caption = str_wrap("Bar plots are grouped by k, the number of studies.", 60),
    x = "treatment"
  ) +
  scale_fill_manual(guide = guide_legend(reverse = TRUE),
                    values = palette(rockthemes::nodoubt_pal()))

```
